result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton J. Sanders

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Cases 21CF427, 22CF123, 22CF173 called at 10:00am 
 Defendant Colton J. Sanders in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Colton J. Sanders.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of 21CF427 and Counts #1 and #2 of Case 22CF123; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Case 22CF173 & Any Remaining Counts of Case 21CF427 & 22CF123
Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Counts #1 and #2 of Case 22CF123, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 4 years.
On Counts #1 and #2 of Case 22CF427, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.

Conditions of Probation: 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no contact with Victim 1 or their residence
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges
--payment of restitution in the amount of $300 payable to Victim (Case 22CF123)
--payment of restitution in the amount of $1367.74 to Acuity Insurance(Case 22CF123)

Days credit for time already served: 5  days, to be applied to Case 21CF427.

recess: 10:20am
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[MK] cases #21CF427, #22CF123, #22CF173 called at 10:38am
Defendant Colton J. Sanders in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.
Attorney Huebner requests another status conference date, explaining that he lost track of Mr. Sanders due to his phone number change.  They have now met and gone over the State's plea offer; Mr. Sanders needs more time to consider the offer. 
recess 10;40am 

NEXT:   Status Conference (possible plea/sent) on September 22nd at 10:00am

Pre-trial conference on August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Colton J. Sanders in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Colton J. Sanders.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty Huebner requests a pretrial and status be scheduled.
--no objection from DA Hall

NEXT: (1)Pretrial on 8/17/22 at 10:00am (2)Status on 9/8/22 at 10:00am
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 11:40 am.

[MK] cases#21CF427, #22CF123 and #22CF173 called at 9:20am
Defendant Colton J. Sanders in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In Cases #22CF123 and #22CF173 Prelim-Waivers and Arraignments are held: 
--Mr. Sanders waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trials.
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered in both cases
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trials.
recess 9:26am
[clerk's inserted post-hearing note:  shortly after the hearing concluded Mr. Sanders indicated that the July 29th status conference date announced by the Court is not a workable date; thereafter the status conference was rescheduled to July 26th.  Counsel and Mr. Sanders were informed of the new date and time.] 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 6th at 11:40am,  (2) Status Conference on July 26th at 2:30pm

Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] cases #21CF427, #22CF123, #22CF173 called at 3:16pm 
Defendant Colton J. Sanders in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Arraignment is held in Case #21CF427:
--Service of Information is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 3:20pm

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on May 18th at 11:00am with ADA Witt,  (2) Status Conference in Case #21CF427 and Preliminary Hearing in the other two cases on June 21st at 9:00am
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

**to cover both 22CF173 and 22CF123**
--no presence at W387 Rockvale Road in the Town of Ixonia
--no use or possession of any firearms or ammunition 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] cases 22CF123 and 22CF173 called 11:38 AM Defendant Colton J. Sanders appeared by telephone in custody from the Jefferson County Jail. Attorney Karl E Huebner in court. ADA Michaels  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court appoints Attorney Huebner to these cases as he is taking over for Attorney Strohschein
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaints are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaints.

The Court requires $5000 Signature Bond to cover both 22CF173 and 22CF123, with conditions:
--no presence at W387 Rockvale Road in the Town of Ixonia
--no use or possession of any firearms or ammunition 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:45 am

Defendant has pending case assigned to Branch 1
